column4: I guess it was ment for me - tnx, but I cant find the 2.6.32 kernel in synaptic .. it is located @ kernel-ppa/mainline/ as .deb files
I have issues with transfer speed copying backups and such since 2-3 weeks back, same as many others out there... would you recommend an older version?
sorry wrote to the wrong guy again  karmic is running on the 2.6.31 branch,  atm,  you'll get updates of those but not for the 2.6.32 one
that kind of recommendation is a bit over my head sorry
what are you using to backup ? I just rsync over my network and it works fine
np - tnx for the answers tho... I dont have my older versions in but that is easily aranged
well the most correct answer is nautilus, I m taking backup on approx 7-8 Gb pictures since I am doing a lot of editing every day
whre are you backing up to ?
the problem is that my hd should be copying these files with 20-25 Mb/s , not 1-2 Mb/s
another partition on same drive
you're reading writing at the same time,  that ' s a lot of work for the reading head
I get that, the physical aspect of the drive should be ok and there is very much free space left
that's the best I can offer, sorry
these problems started after an kernel update - thats why I came in with these questions
tnx a lot anyway and have a good night

well if you need to go back a version then that' s easy enought,   open synaptic  do a search for 2.6.31 , that should give you the kernel headers and images and such  , make sure you have those installed for previous versions ,curent one is 2.6.31-17 so look for -16
I am looking for 13-14 . Think it would be best to take few steps back and start there.
the downgrade solved my kernel issues last night - just wanted to thank you guys again
no problem , we live for gratitude
do you by any chance know how I set 2.6.31-14 as default on every restart.. I just noticed to be back on -17

you can remove the kernel's you donT' want from synaptic but you an also set the kernel you want to boot in the  /etc/default/grub file,  assuming you are using grub2 ,   in grub one you need to select it in  /boot/grub/menu.lst
thank you again, have a good evening guys
